duties_responsibilities.duty: Plan and implement lesson plans and activities for Preschool/Pre-K children, aligning with curriculum requirements.
Supervise Assistant Teachers and/or Teacher Aides, ensuring classroom activities are in line with teaching objectives.
Teach a comprehensive program including Music, Art, Literacy, Math, and Science, contributing to the development of various skills in children.
Maintain and arrange the appearance of the classroom, following Human Services guidelines, and preparing necessary supplies.
Attend monthly staff meetings, communicate effectively with parents, and hold bi-annual parent conferences to discuss child progress.
Demonstrate excellent public relations and customer service skills when interacting with participants, parents, and staff.
Maintain a professional attitude while supporting the objectives of the Preschool program and treat all children with dignity and respect.

Must be able to repeatedly sit, walk, stand, climb, bend, kneel, stoop, reach and lift, push, and pull. Must be able to type, write, use a calculator, use a computer, and answer the telephone. Ability to communicate face-to-face is needed.
Obtain a Teacher Qualification letter from the state within 60 days of employment and complete all Human Services requirements, CPR and First Aid.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Early Childhood Education or a related field, Teaching Certification required
